items.title: Web Developer Experience at Mfatech
items.description: During my time at Mfatech as a web developer, I worked primarily on a site-builder project where I designed and implemented a dynamic intranet website generation system. This project required combining a wide range of technologies. I built an HTML data-attribute–based framework to enable dynamic page rendering, created a selector-scoping mechanism to prevent style conflicts across components, developed a GrapesJS-based visual editor to provide a user-friendly editing experience, and leveraged web APIs such as IndexedDB to improve page load performance. In addition, I gained substantial experience working within a team, improved my Git workflow, and expanded my knowledge into areas such as CI/CD and Redis thanks to my colleagues. Across other projects, I also had the opportunity to work with WebSocket APIs, deepen my understanding of React Native, and gain introductory experience with Python Flask. Throughout this period, I developed strong skills in scalability, data integrity, and building sustainable application architectures.

items.title: Refination
items.description: Refination is a refinement tool for Scrum projects. With this tool, teams can come together to plan their tasks and determine story points. We used this project at mfatech where I worked as a frontend developer. I wanted it to come out as soon as possible so i kept the design minimal with fun emojis and used firebase for real time capabilities.

items.title: Tabula Notes
items.description: Tabula Notes is a markdown-inspired note-taking app built for personal use. Working with notes is an indispensable habit for me and no markdown editor I've ever used met my needs. That's why I created Tabula, with the ability to scroll sideways and downwards just like notebook pages, it is ideal for my note-taking style. This app was created to meet my needs only. I may make it open to other users in the future. The app is down at the moment.

items.title: TPÖÇG Blog Machine v2
items.description: This is the second version of Blog Machine, created with Vite + React. When I was leading the Publication Design Team of the Turkish Psychology Students Working Group ( TPÖÇG) for a year, the most frequent and urgent task we had to do was to prepare the templates of blog posts for Instagram posts. For a simple task like this, we were expected to use Photoshop every time. I thought it was a huge waste of time and created the first version of this app to solve this situation. Not only is the design more elegant, but it's also faster and more reliable because it's built with React. It also became more useful with the new 'reset', 'dark mode' and other blog post templates I added.

items.title: TPÖÇG Card Website
items.description: TPÖÇG Card is a joint work of TPÖÇG Sponsorship Team and Financial Affairs Coordinatorship. It aims to provide TPÖÇG members with discounts at contracted businesses. Although the card has never been made physical as far as I know, I was assigned by my team mate in charge to promote the card and create a digital version of it, and that's why I created this website. In addition to using pure HTML, CSS and JavaScript, I used html2canvas CDN to enable cardholders to download their personalized card image.
